summary: This document is an email chain from September 2020 between Jill Greenfield, a partner at Fieldfisher law firm, and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York. They are scheduling a video conference call to discuss questions from Greenfield's client regarding the Epstein investigation, as government travel was prohibited due to Covid-19.

persons.name: Jill Greenfield
persons.context: Attorney representing a client who wishes to speak with the U.S. Attorney's Office about the Epstein investigation. She initiates and coordinates the scheduling of a video conference.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Prosecutor from the SDNY handling the Epstein investigation. Corresponds with Jill Greenfield to schedule a video conference with her client and discusses logistical constraints on government travel.

connections.description: Legal professionals corresponding to arrange a discussion between the prosecutor's office and Greenfield's client regarding the Epstein investigation.
Greenfield is the legal representative for a client who has questions about the Epstein investigation and wishes to speak with prosecutors.
The prosecutor's office is seeking to communicate with Greenfield's client as part of their ongoing Epstein investigation.

events.title: Scheduled Video Conference
events.description: A video conference call is scheduled for 10:00 AM between the U.S. Attorney's Office and Jill Greenfield's client to discuss the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Initial Contact Regarding Client Meeting
events.description: Jill Greenfield emails the U.S. Attorney's Office to inform them her client wishes to speak about the Epstein investigation and ask about potential travel.

locations: Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Fieldfisher, Riverbank House, 2 Swan Lane, London EC4R 3TT, United Kingdom
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively investigating the Epstein case as of September 2020.
A client of attorney Jill Greenfield, whose identity is not disclosed, sought to speak with prosecutors, indicating ongoing witness or victim cooperation.
Government travel for the prosecutors was prohibited at the time due to Covid-19 restrictions, necessitating a video conference.
The email chain shows coordination between a UK-based law firm and U.S. federal prosecutors, indicating the international scope of the investigation.
The subject line 'Epstein [FFW-DOCS.FID6003375]' suggests this is part of a specific document series or case file related to the investigation.
